summary: The Energy Threat Analysis Program Act of 2025 (S. 1902) mandates the Secretary of Energy to establish an energy threat analysis program (ETAP). This program, managed by the Office of Cybersecurity, Energy Security, and Emergency Response, aims to enhance the security of the energy sector by analyzing threats, supporting public-private collaboration, informing research, and enhancing emergency response capabilities. It involves coordination with various federal agencies and non-federal entities, with a focus on protecting shared information. The Act authorizes $50 million in appropriations for fiscal years 2025-2029 and sunsets after 10 years.  No entities of concern can participate. Annual reports to Congress are required.
